verses.verse: And the word<WH1697> of Samuel<WH8050> came to all Israel<WH3478>. Now Israel<WH3478> went out<WH3318> against<WH7125> the Philistines<WH6430> to battle<WH4421>, and encamped<WH2583> beside Eben-ezer<WH72>: and the Philistines<WH6430> encamped<WH2583> in Aphek<WH663>.

And the Philistines<WH6430> put themselves in array<WH6186> against<WH7125> Israel<WH3478>: and when they joined<WH5203> battle<WH4421>, Israel<WH3478> was smitten<WH5062> before<WH6440> the Philistines<WH6430>; and they slew<WH5221> of the army<WH4634> in the field<WH7704> about four<WH702> thousand<WH505> men<WH376>.

And when the people<WH5971> were come<WH935> into the camp<WH4264>, the elders<WH2205> of Israel<WH3478> said<WH559>, Wherefore hath Jehovah<WH3068> smitten<WH5062> us to-day<WH3117> before<WH6440> the Philistines<WH6430>? Let us fetch<WH3947> the ark<WH727> of the covenant<WH1285> of Jehovah<WH3068> out of Shiloh<WH7887> unto us<WH935>, that it may come among<WH7130> us<WH3467>, and save us out of the hand<WH3709> of our enemies<WH341>.

So the people<WH5971> sent<WH7971> to Shiloh<WH7887>; and they brought<WH5375> from thence the ark<WH727> of the covenant<WH1285> of Jehovah<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>, who sitteth<WH3427> above the cherubim<WH3742>: and the two<WH8147> sons<WH1121> of Eli<WH5941>, Hophni<WH2652> and Phinehas<WH6372>, were there with the ark<WH727> of the covenant<WH1285> of God<WH430>.

And when the ark<WH727> of the covenant<WH1285> of Jehovah<WH3068> came<WH935> into the camp<WH4264>, all Israel<WH3478> shouted<WH7321> with a great<WH1419> shout<WH8643>, so that the earth<WH776> rang again<WH1949>.

And when the Philistines<WH6430> heard<WH8085> the noise<WH6963> of the shout<WH8643>, they said<WH559>, What meaneth the noise<WH6963> of this great<WH1419> shout<WH8643> in the camp<WH4264> of the Hebrews<WH5680>? And they understood<WH3045> that the ark<WH727> of Jehovah<WH3068> was come<WH935> into the camp<WH4264>.

And the Philistines<WH6430> were afraid<WH3372>, for they said<WH559>, God<WH430> is come<WH935> into the camp<WH4264>. And they said<WH559>, Woe<WH188> unto us<WH865>! for there hath not been such a thing heretofore.

Woe <WH188> unto us<WH5337>! who shall deliver us out of the hand<WH3027> of these mighty<WH117> gods<WH430>? these are the gods<WH430> that smote<WH5221> the Egyptians<WH4714> with all manner of plagues<WH4347> in the wilderness<WH4057>.

Be strong<WH2388>, and quit<WH1961> yourselves like men<WH582>, O ye Philistines<WH6430>, that ye be not servants<WH5647> unto the Hebrews<WH5680>, as they have been<WH5647> to you<WH1961>: quit yourselves like men<WH582>, and fight<WH3898>.

And the Philistines<WH6430> fought<WH3898>, and Israel<WH3478> was smitten<WH5062>, and they fled<WH5127> every man<WH376> to his tent<WH168>: and there was a very<WH3966> great<WH1419> slaughter<WH4347>; for there fell<WH5307> of Israel<WH3478> thirty<WH7970> thousand<WH505> footmen<WH7273>.
And the ark<WH727> of God<WH430> was taken<WH3947>; and the two<WH8147> sons<WH1121> of Eli<WH5941>, Hophni<WH2652> and Phinehas<WH6372>, were slain<WH4191>.

And there ran<WH7323> a man<WH376> of Benjamin<WH1144> out of the army<WH4634>, and came<WH935> to Shiloh<WH7887> the same day<WH3117>, with his clothes<WH4055> rent<WH7167>, and with earth<WH127> upon his head<WH7218>.

And when he came<WH935>, lo<WH5941>, Eli was sitting<WH3427> upon his seat<WH3678> by the wayside<WH3027> watching<WH6822>; for his heart<WH3820> trembled<WH2730> for the ark<WH727> of God<WH430>. And when the man<WH376> came<WH935> into the city<WH5892>, and told<WH5046> it<WH5892>, all the city cried out<WH2199>.

And when Eli<WH5941> heard<WH8085> the noise<WH6963> of the crying<WH6818>, he said<WH559>, What meaneth the noise<WH6963> of this tumult<WH1995>? And the man<WH376> hasted<WH4116>, and came<WH935> and told<WH5046> Eli<WH5941>.
Now Eli<WH5941> was ninety<WH8673> and eight<WH8083> years<WH8141> old<WH1121>; and his eyes<WH5869> were set<WH6965>, so that he could<WH3201> not see<WH7200>.

And the man<WH376> said<WH559> unto Eli<WH5941>, I am he that came<WH935> out of the army<WH4634>, and I fled<WH5127> to-day<WH3117> out of the army<WH4634>. And he said<WH559>, How went the matter<WH1697>, my son<WH1121>?

And he<WH1319> that brought the tidings answered<WH6030> and said<WH6030>, Israel<WH3478> is fled<WH5127> before<WH6440> the Philistines<WH6430>, and there hath been also a great<WH1419> slaughter<WH4046> among the people<WH5971>, and thy two<WH8147> sons<WH1121> also<WH2652>, Hophni and Phinehas<WH6372>, are dead<WH4191>, and the ark<WH727> of God<WH430> is taken<WH3947>.

And it came to pass<WH2142>, when he made mention of the ark<WH727> of God<WH430>, that Eli fell<WH5307> from off his seat<WH3678> backward<WH322> by<WH1157> the side<WH3027> of the gate<WH8179>; and his neck<WH4665> brake<WH7665>, and he died<WH4191>: for he was an old<WH2204> man<WH376>, and heavy<WH3513>. And he had judged<WH8199> Israel<WH3478> forty<WH705> years<WH8141>.

And his daughter-in<WH3618>-law, Phinehas<WH6372>' wife<WH802>, was with child<WH2030>, near to be delivered<WH3205>: and when she heard<WH8085> the tidings<WH8052> that<WH413> the ark<WH727> of God<WH430> was taken<WH3947>, and that her father-in<WH2524>-law and her husband<WH376> were dead<WH4191>, she bowed<WH3766> herself and brought forth<WH3205>; for her pains<WH6735> came upon her<WH2015>.

And about the time<WH6256> of her death<WH4191> the women that stood<WH5324> by her said<WH1696> unto her<WH3372>, Fear not<WH3205>; for thou hast brought forth a son<WH1121>. But she answered<WH6030> not<WH7896>, neither did she regard it.

And she named<WH7121> the child<WH5288> Ichabod<WH350>, saying<WH559>, The glory<WH3519> is departed<WH1540> from Israel<WH3478>; because<WH413> the ark<WH727> of God<WH430> was taken<WH3947>, and because of her father-in<WH2524>-law and her husband<WH376>.
And she said<WH559>, The glory<WH3519> is departed<WH1540> from Israel<WH3478>; for the ark<WH727> of God<WH430> is taken<WH3947>.
